data.title: OpenRA fails to launch on Gentoo Linux: libopenal.so.1 can't be found
data.body:
Hi,

On Gentoo Linux both OpenRA playtest 20170304 and 20170408 I get this error:

```bash
Platform is Linux 
Using SDL 2 with OpenGL renderer 
Desktop resolution: 1600x900 
No custom resolution provided, using desktop resolution 
Using resolution: 1600x900 
Using window scale 1.00 
OpenGL version: 3.0 Mesa 17.0.3 
Using default sound device 
Renderer initialization failed. Check graphics.log for details. 
Using SDL 2 with OpenGL renderer 
Desktop resolution: 1600x900 
No custom resolution provided, using desktop resolution 
Using resolution: 1600x900 
Using window scale 1.00 
OpenGL version: 3.0 Mesa 17.0.3 
Using default sound device 
Renderer initialization failed. Check graphics.log for details. 
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Failed to initialize platform-integration library. Check graphics.log for details. 
 at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) [0x00116] in <96f18ea93b7243efbb9796e0b8fa3e27>:0  
 at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00006] in <96f18ea93b7243efbb9796e0b8fa3e27>:0  
 at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00048] in <96f18ea93b7243efbb9796e0b8fa3e27>:0  


(zenity:1983): Gtk-WARNING **: Theme parsing error: gtk.css:1036:92: Missing closing bracket at end of linear gradient 

(zenity:1983): Gtk-WARNING **: Theme parsing error: gtk.css:1036:94: Expected semicolon 

(zenity:1983): Gtk-WARNING **: Theme parsing error: gtk.css:1036:124: Expected semicolon 

(zenity:1983): Gtk-WARNING **: Theme parsing error: gtk.css:1147:50: Expected semicolon 

(zenity:1983): Gtk-WARNING **: Theme parsing error: gtk.css:3129:50: Expected semicolon 
Gtk-Message: GtkDialog mapped without a transient parent. This is discouraged
```

while [here](http://paste2.org/BPK8XkgZ) are the contents of `~/.openra/graphics.log`. [Here](http://paste2.org/xCLycC1U) are the contents of `exception-2017-04-11T105334Z.log`. Not sure why I'm getting this error. My Mono version is 4.8.0, is there some problem with building OpenRA against this version of Mono?

Thanks for your time,
Brenton

data.title: Fix/Disable Edge scroll while standard (middle mouse) scroll
data.body:
Fixes this issue - you're scrolling map (e.g. Rock in image below) with mouse middle button to right and it starts scrolling in opposite direction when you are near border though you still keep middle button and move your mouse to right.

Fixes #3757, #12965

data.title: openRA crash on start openSUSE Leap 42.2 XFCE
data.body:
opening with the terminal gives this:
```

No custom resolution provided, using desktop resolution
Using resolution: 1920x1080
Using window scale 1.00
OpenGL version: 3.0 Mesa 11.2.2
Using default sound device
ALSA lib pcm_dmix.c:1077:(snd_pcm_dmix_open) unable to create IPC shm instance
AL lib: (EE) ALCplaybackAlsa_open: Could not open playback device 'default': Invalid argument
Failed to open device. Falling back to default
ALSA lib pcm_dmix.c:1077:(snd_pcm_dmix_open) unable to create IPC shm instance
AL lib: (EE) ALCplaybackAlsa_open: Could not open playback device 'default': Invalid argument
Renderer initialization failed. Check graphics.log for details.
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Failed to initialize platform-integration library. Check graphics.log for details.
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) [0x0011b] in <c04fecf34d0e4bf383d47cf37435b845>:0

Gtk-Message: GtkDialog mapped without a transient parent. This is discouraged.
vincent@linux-zp7s:~> 
```
```

> Date: 2017-04-09 15:01:46Z
> Operating System: Linux (Unix 4.4.49.16)
> Runtime Version: Mono 4.6.1 (Stable 4.6.1.3/abb06f1 Thu Oct 20 14:33:14 UTC 2016) CLR 4.0.30319.42000

```
Graphics.log says:


data.title: Rename weapon "Burst" to "Shots"
data.body: Burst → ShotCount, BurstDelay → ShotDelay.  This would make it much easier to use consistent terminology for shots vs salvos in `[Desc()]` and other places.  Follow on to the discussion in #13041.

data.title: Fix Pre-damaged bridge tiles visually transform to new #13076
data.body: Fixed DamagedTemplate (e.g. 236) health to 49% (Heavy damage) as current 50% was still Medium so it was refreshed to Template (e.g. 235).

data.title: Fix duplicate muzzle rendering.
data.body:
Fixes #10763.

The Render method was rendering *all* animations for each armament type, so actors with secondary armaments (even if they don't have muzzles) would render the primary muzzleflash once with its normal palette, then again with the secondary muzzle palette.

The real bugfix here is the loop change from armament → animation to armament → barrel.  This also simplifies/removes unnecessary some unnecessary checks.

data.title: mods/ra/maps: update Winter Storm
data.body:
Map link: http://resource.openra.net/maps/20503/

Old | New
--- | ---
![openra-2017-04-09t095447104z](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1079123/24836501/06dc5ca8-1d26-11e7-99a6-e0e9a8d2c846.png) | ![openra-2017-04-09t094805748z](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1079123/24836502/09799b06-1d26-11e7-8068-054480d1fb74.png)

Changes:

* Renamed from `Winter Storm 2` to `Winter Storm`
* Decorated the chain links near middle oil derricks
* Resized the map from 89x82 to 89x86 to add more sea tiles to the top
  and to the bottom
* Fixed broken tile near the ridge to the middle right

data.title: base game music only disables music player
data.body: When the v2 game music isn't installed, but the game assets through quick install, you get one music track, but no way to mute/stop/pause it as the audio player has greyed out buttons and tells you to please install the music instead of showing the current tracks.

data.title: mods/ra/maps: update Behind the Veil
data.body:
Map link: http://resource.openra.net/maps/20494/

Old | New
--- | ---
![openra-2017-04-09t084719866z](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1079123/24836053/7b7c1622-1d1a-11e7-8e8f-c3d0bf392145.png) | ![openra-2017-04-09t082022824z](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1079123/24836054/9ba3505a-1d1a-11e7-9639-d7427ae6af89.png)

Changes:

* Renamed from `Behind The Veil 2` to `Behind the Veil`
* Replaced chain link with walls in the middle to protect oil derricks
  from direct attacks
* Added barrels to the middle area. A middle oil derrick can be
  captured only from 2 spots (if barrels were not destroyed)
* Added barrels between side ridges
* Fixed some bad road tiles (thanks to Frame Limiter)
* Widen side passages to corner expansions by 1 cell

data.title: Opening .orarep or .oramod files opens the latest OpenRA installation.
data.body:
(Windows 7) This is a minor inconvenience if you know this but likely a problem for those who don't. So the latest installment of OpenRA be it a release or playtest will be the go-to client for any replay or mod file opened directly from Windows. If you just installed the latest playtest for example, your files will open it and display a message 'Missing Dependencies' and ask you to fully install the correct client version.

For me it's a minor inconvenience but for newer users probably confusing since they likely already have the necessary client installed.

data.title: Fix Heli goes to pad if SD is occupied #12991
data.body:
If target is reserved Repair building, do nothing instead of searching for next HeliBase. So it doesn't fly away and you can send it again to repair. 
Not changed - if target is reserved Rearm building (HeliBase), go to next free HeliBase like so far.

See #12991 for additional explanation.

data.title: Make TS explosions + muzzle flashes unaffected by global lighting

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body:
The new `effect-ignore-lighting` palette and its derivatives are not affected by global lighting, making weapon effects light up fully even on darker maps (except pistol/rifle/machine gun piffs, since that is presumably meant to be dust kicked up).

~Disclaimer: Mammoth Tank and GDI Component Tower need that yaml work-around until `WithMuzzleOverlay` is fixed (#10763), and yes, I already tried and failed to fix it.~

data.title: Fix crash when carryall cargo is killed on same tick as pickup.
data.body: Fixes #13032.

data.title: Enable Ability to Target GPS Icons
data.body:
Have the opposing enemy's GPS Icons targetable by units. This opens up possibly for attacks instead 
of force firing into fog while GPS is enabled. Ideally not a balance breaking feature as the ability to attack is already enabled.

![screen shot 2017-04-07 at 10 45 17 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14940856/24825009/f0448076-1be3-11e7-8c25-15038205af51.png)

edit: reticle wont display desired cursor for screen cap: "unable to target" cursor

data.title: Spawnpoint mousover fails in lobby minimap
data.body:
In lobby, sometimes when the focus is another place, the MapPreviewWidget fails to show spawnpoint on mouseover. This could make it hard to fix teams.
A way to fix this, is to bring focus on the minimap again, but that could deselect your spawnpoint.

data.title: Pre-damaged bridge tiles visually transform to new when attacked
data.body:
In RA if you create a map with the pre-damaged bridge tiles 236, 242, and 239 they'll visually transform back to full health when taking a small amount of damage.

Before attacking:
![openra-2017-04-07t134605702z](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22008761/24802767/2301e2a0-1b77-11e7-9bbc-c1da277e1386.png)
After attacking (1 rifle shot):
![openra-2017-04-07t134625264z](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22008761/24802768/26f34192-1b77-11e7-8502-846f40fa4911.png)

data.title: Custom Sprite support for mods.
data.body:
This allows mods to extend the Sprite class without modifying the OpenRA.Game or OpenRA.Common project.

In my current project, i have per-frame offset-points, which need to be stored for every sprite. With this modification i can implement it purely on the mod-side.

data.title: Better Support for Multiple Condition Expressions in a Trait
data.body:
Replaces IConditionConsumer with variable observer delegates for handling multiple condition expressions by traits.

~This is cherry-picked from #12955 (Remove IDisable - part 1) and was cherry-picked for #13057 (Grant Condition Integers) as well. Delegates are a simple to use mechanism for handling multiple `ConditionExpression`s. In most cases, a trait class defines a method for each `ConditionExpression`.~

data.title: Fix ConditionManager.GrantCondition doc
data.body: This is a small fix I made to the documentation for `public int GrantCondition(Actor self, string condition, int duration = 0)` in `OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.ConditionManager` removing a reference to a parameter already removed by the external conditions refactoring.

data.title: Color picker update - built-in mod colors and a user palette

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
Hi,

I had a go at updating the color picker. Now it has: 

- A set of preset color swatches for RA1 and TD, (defined in mod.yaml: TeamColorPresets: C4B060, 4494E4, ....)

- A user-defined palette defined in settings.yaml (Player: CustomColors: 3B99CA, A33BCA, ....)

![openra color picker](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1639681/24783881/69daa73c-1b92-11e7-8972-703ef7709b2f.jpg)

This is my first time contributing to this project so hopefully I have done it correctly and haven't broken any rules.

I'd also like to know what preset colors were available in d2k, TS, and RA2 so I can add them into the mod.yaml for each of these mods. Does anyone happen to know?

Cheers

data.title: Display team arrangement in Lobby and Replay

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
Display current team arrangement in lobby e.g. 
[ 1 v 1 ], [ FFA ], [ 2 v 2 v 1 v 1], [ 3 v 2 + 3 ]
' + x' means x players without team

![obrazok](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16348750/26673295/a6698286-46bc-11e7-90c3-b7ff676f0afc.png)
